sections.title: Syntax
sections.raw_content:
A standardType is one of:

  (a) int
  (b) real
  (c) string [ ( maximumLength ) ]
  (d) boolean
  (e) nat     % natural number
  (f) intn     % n-byte integer (n=1, 2, 4)
  (g) natn     % n-byte natural (n= 1, 2, 4)
  (h) realn   % n-byte real (n=4, 8)
  (i) char     % single character
  (j) char(n)   % n characters
sections.text_content:
A standardType is one of:
 (a)int (b)real (c)string [ ( maximumLength ) ] (d)boolean (e)nat  % natural number (f)intn  % n-byte integer (n=1, 2, 4) (g)natn  % n-byte natural (n= 1, 2, 4) (h)realn % n-byte real (n=4, 8) (i)char  % single character (j)char(n) % n characters
sections.mdown_content:
A _standardType_ is one of:   
-  **int**   
-  **real**   
-  **string** [ ( _maximumLength_ ) ]   
-  **boolean**   
-  **nat**     _% natural number_   
-  **int**_n_     _% n-byte integer (n=1_, _2_, _4)_   
-  **nat**_n_     _% n-byte natural (n= 1_, _2_, _4)_   
-  **real**_n_   _% n-byte real (n=4_, _8)_   
-  **char**     _% single character_   
-  **char**(_n_)   _% n characters_

sections.title: Description
sections.raw_content: The standard types can be used throughout a program. They should not be included in an import list.
sections.text_content: The standard types can be used throughout a program. They should not be included in an import list.
sections.mdown_content: The standard types can be used throughout a program. They should not be included in an **import** list.

sections.title: See also
sections.raw_content: int, real, string and boolean. See also nat, intn, natn, realn, char, char(n)
sections.text_content: int, real, string and boolean. See also nat, intn, natn, realn, char, char(n)
